column4: anyone have success running skype for linux, with video? is skype+linux+video there yet?
I regularly video call with Skype
the Linux client is a bit janky, but that's more about some of my contacts can't search for me when I'm logged in. Most functions work
which version of skype? maybe my issue is setting up my cam
I've managed to install Skype (Beta) Version 2.1.0.81, which version is yours?
um, privmsg w/ me we can talk about Skype, it's just a tad off topic here
ah, you could.  The LJ IIIP is a nice old printer for sure ;)
aren't your rubber rollers worn out and cracked yet though?
we bought this one damned near 20 years ago .. still works great.. have repaired a few things on it
I have replaced the clutch, the laser, and the rollers.. I think the top rollers are due for replacement
yeah.. I am installing 10.10 on an older deskpro.. hoping to plug this printer as well as a scanner into this box.. to act as my print and scan server
usb-parallel adapter on your desktop machine might be more efficient
I know I could buy a box from HP et al, that would give the printer an IP.. but this box is just sitting around..
usb-parallel? is that a hardware device?
yeah it's parallel port on one side, and usb on the other, so you can plug old stuff into USB capable computer
well, my wife and boys print to this printer.. on home LAN.. so I need to have it on.. but I guess they COULD send their jobs to it and then come down and switch the printer on
lights dim when you turn it on? ;)
